resources.string: Automatically download attachments for incoming emails
Only download attachments when manually requested
Write to remember it in your words...
Click on mic icon to speak
Your speech when detected will be shown here .

string-array.name: definitions
string-array.item: 1. A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically one that is unwelcome.
1. Solemnly renounce (a belief, cause, or claim)
1. Repeal or do away with (a law, right, or formal agreement)
1. An award or privilege granted as a special honor or as an acknowledgment of merit.
1. The point at which someone or something is best, perfect, or most successful.
1. Make a formal judgment or decision about a problem or disputed matter.
1. Giving or conveying a warning or reprimand.
1. A person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause or policy.1. Publicly recommend or support.
1. A person who has or affects to have a special appreciation of art and beauty.
1. Friendly, good-natured, or easy to talk to.
(especially of a group or area) having a great deal of money1. A tributary stream.
1. The belief in or practice of disinterested and selfless concern for the well-being of others.
(of language) open to more than one interpretation
1. Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
(of a person) open and responsive to suggestion
1. Having or displaying a friendly and pleasant manner.
1. A thing belonging or appropriate to a period other than that in which it exists, especially a thing that is conspicuously old-fashioned.
1. Comparable in certain respects, typically in a way which makes clearer the nature of the things compared.
1. Something or someone that one vehemently dislikes.
Not likely to provoke dissent or offense1. A painkilling drug or medicine.
1. Something that deviates from what is standard, normal, or expected.
1. Showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
1. Lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
1. The top or highest part of something, especially one forming a point.1. Reach a high point or climax.
1. A pithy observation that contains a general truth, such as, “if it ain\'t broke, don\'t fix it.”
1. Self-confidence or assurance, especially when in a demanding situation.
1. (of a story or statement) of doubtful authenticity, although widely circulated as being true.
The highest point in the development of something
1. A person who renounces a religious or political belief or principle.1. Abandoning a religious or political belief or principle.
The highest point in the development of something
1. Pacify or placate (someone) by acceding to their demands.
1. Large or important enough to be noticed.
1. Anxiety or fear that something bad or unpleasant will happen.
1. A curved symmetrical structure spanning an opening and typically supporting the weight of a bridge, roof, or wall above it.1. Have the curved shape of an arch.
1. An ambitious or ruthlessly self-seeking person, especially one who has recently acquired wealth or social status.
1. (of a person or action) clever or skillful, typically in a crafty or cunning way.
1. Clever or cunning devices or expedients, especially as used to trick or deceive others.
ss1. Occupation of a position of dominant power or influence.

1. Characterized by or suggesting the practice of severe self-discipline and abstention from all forms of indulgence, typically for religious reasons.1. A person who practices severe self-discipline and abstention.
1. Make a concerted or violent attack on.
1. A tendency to revert to something ancient or ancestral.
1. Reduce the force, effect, or value of.1. Reduced in force, effect, or physical thickness.
1. Showing a willingness to take surprisingly bold risks.
1. Having or showing a keen interest in or enthusiasm for something.
1. A heavily built omnivorous nocturnal mammal of the weasel family, typically having a gray and black coat.Repeatedly ask (someone) to do something
1. Hesitate or be unwilling to accept an idea or undertaking.1. An illegal motion made by a pitcher that may deceive a base runner.
1. So lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring.
1. Send (someone) away from a country or place as an official punishment.
1. Ask (someone) earnestly or humbly for something.
1. Envy (someone) the possession or enjoyment of (something)
1. It is a duty or responsibility for someone to do something.
(of an appearance) fail to give a true notion or impression of (something)
1. Hostile and aggressive.1. A nation or person engaged in war or conflict, as recognized by international law.
1. Deprived of or lacking something, especially a nonmaterial asset.
1. Damage the reputation of (someone or something) in the opinion of others.
1. Affected by or associated with nausea or vomiting.
1. (of bad behavior) done openly and unashamedly.
1. A long, thick pillow that is placed under other pillows for support.Support or strengthen
1. Remove material that is considered improper or offensive from (a text or account), especially with the result that the text becomes weaker or less effective.
1. The headgear used to control a horse, consisting of buckled straps to which a bit and reins are attached.1. Put a bridle on (a horse)
1. A short stiff hair, typically one of those on an animal\'s skin, a man\'s face, or a plant.1. (of hair or fur) stand upright away from the skin, especially in anger or fear.
1. A compound of bromine with another element or group, especially a salt containing the anion Br⁻ or an organic compound with bromine bonded to an alkyl radical.
1. Intimidate (someone), typically into doing something, with stern or abusive words.
Acting in a confused or ineffectual way
Begin to grow or increase rapidly1. A bud or young shoot.
1. Relating to Byzantium (now Istanbul), the Byzantine Empire, or the Eastern Orthodox Church.1. A citizen of Byzantium or the Byzantine Empire.
1. Resembling a corpse in being very pale, thin, or bony.
1. (of a young person) inexperienced and immature.
The making of false and defamatory statements about someone in order to damage their reputation

1. A leading dignitary of the Roman Catholic Church. Cardinals are nominated by the Pope, and form the Sacred College which elects succeeding popes (now invariably from among their own number)Of the greatest importance
1. A large-scale and violent event in the natural world.
1. A substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction without itself undergoing any permanent chemical change.
1. Showing a lack of proper concern

1. An official who examines material that is about to be released, such as books, movies, news, and art, and suppresses any parts that are considered obscene, politically unacceptable, or a threat to security.1. Examine (a book, movie, etc.) officially and suppress unacceptable parts of it.
1. Express severe disapproval of (someone or something), especially in a formal statement.1. The expression of formal disapproval.
1. Distress or embarrassment at having failed or been humiliated.1. Feel distressed or humiliated.
1. A person who has defeated or surpassed all rivals in a competition, especially in sports.Support the cause of
1. Cautiously or suspiciously reluctant to do something.

1. Examine (something) in order to determine its accuracy, quality, or condition, or to detect the presence of something.1. An examination to test or ascertain accuracy, quality, or satisfactory condition.1. Expressing assent or agreement.
1. (in Greek mythology) a fire-breathing female monster with a lion\'s head, a goat\'s body, and a serpent\'s tail.
1. (of a man or his behavior) courteous and gallant, especially toward women.
Laugh in a breathy, gleeful way1. A breathy, gleeful laugh.
1. Rude in a mean-spirited and surly way.
1. Come together to form one mass or whole.
1. (of an argument or case) clear, logical, and convincing.
1. Secret or illegal cooperation or conspiracy, especially in order to cheat or deceive others.
1. Showing smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one\'s achievements.
s1. Involved with others in an illegal activity or wrongdoing.
A thing that is composed of two or more separate elements1. Made up or consisting of two or more existing parts or elements.Make up (a composite whole)
Stop (someone) from being angry or discontented
1. Naturally accompanying or associated.1. A phenomenon that naturally accompanies or follows something.
1. An extensive fire which destroys a great deal of land or property.
1. Combine (two or more texts, ideas, etc.) into one.
1. Cause surprise or confusion in (someone), especially by acting against their expectations.1. Used to express anger or annoyance.
1. Given to or involved in conspiring to do something immoral, illegal, or harmful.
Make or declare (something, typically a church) sacred
1. Being a part of a whole.1. A member of a constituency.
1. Interpret (a word or action) in a particular way.
1. Make (a marriage or relationship) complete by having sexual intercourse.Showing a high degree of skill and flair
1. Subject to chance.1. A group of people united by some common feature, forming part of a larger group.
Feeling or expressing remorse or penitence
1. The state of feeling remorseful and penitent.
1. Create or bring about (an object or a situation) by deliberate use of skill and artifice.
1. A confusing and difficult problem or question.
1. (especially of an argument, story, or sentence) extremely complex and difficult to follow.
1. A symbol of plenty consisting of a goat\'s horn overflowing with flowers, fruit, and corn.
1. A proposition that follows from (and is often appended to) one already proved.1. Forming a proposition that follows from one already proved.
1. Confirm or give support to (a statement, theory, or finding)
Cared for and protected in an overindulgent way
1. Having the same boundaries or extent in space, time, or meaning.
1. Revoke (an order)1. An order revoking a previous one.
1. A fully grown female animal of a domesticated breed of ox, kept to produce milk or beef.
Contemptibly lacking in courage1. A cowardly person.
1. (of a performance, effort, or action) deserving public acknowledgment and praise but not necessarily outstanding or successful.
Large or heavy and therefore difficult to carry or use
1. A scarcity or lack of something.
1. Expose the falseness or hollowness of (a myth, idea, or belief)
In keeping with good taste and propriety
1. Behavior in keeping with good taste and propriety.
1. Provide money to pay (a cost or expense)
1. Treat or regard (someone) with contempt or disrespect.
1. Do something that one considers to be beneath one\'s dignity.

1. A person sent or authorized to represent others, in particular an elected representative sent to a conference.1. Entrust (a task or responsibility) to another person, typically one who is less senior than oneself.
1. Done consciously and intentionally.1. Engage in long and careful consideration.
1. Cause a severe loss in the dignity of and respect for (someone or something)
1. (of a person) tending to show feelings, especially of affection, openly.1. A demonstrative determiner or pronoun.
1. Raise doubts or objections or show reluctance.1. The action or process of objecting to or hesitating over something.
1. (of a woman or her behavior) reserved, modest, and shy.
1. The final part of a play, movie, or narrative in which the strands of the plot are drawn together and matters are explained or resolved.
1. In a very poor condition as a result of disuse and neglect.1. A person without a home, job, or property.
1. (typically of an artist or work of art) imitative of the work of another person, and usually disapproved of for that reason.1. Something that is based on another source.
1. Something that is needed or wanted.
1. A ruler or other person who holds absolute power, typically one who exercises it in a cruel or oppressive way.
1. Without the basic necessities of life.
1. Discourage (someone) from doing something by instilling doubt or fear of the consequences.
1. Transfer or delegate (power) to a lower level, especially from central government to local or regional administration.
1. A forceful and bitter verbal attack against someone or something.
1. Of or typical of a ruler with total power.
1. Recognize or ascertain what makes (someone or something) different.
1. Modest or shy because of a lack of self-confidence.
1. Extremely or unusually small.1. A diminutive word or suffix.
1. Persuade (someone) that an idea or belief is mistaken.
1. Dissatisfied with the people in authority and no longer willing to support them.
1. Careful and circumspect in one\'s speech or actions, especially in order to avoid causing offense or to gain an advantage.
1. Deprive (someone) of the right to vote.
1. Not candid or sincere, typically by pretending that one knows less about something than one really does.
1. Not influenced by considerations of personal advantage.
Essentially different in kind1. Things so unlike that there is no basis for comparison.
1. Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial.
1. Exemption from a rule or usual requirement.
1. Conceal one\'s true motives, feelings, or beliefs.
1. (with reference to a feeling or other intangible thing) disappear or cause to disappear.
1. The closing down or dismissal of an assembly, partnership, or official body.

1. A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, nonretractable claws, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.1. Follow (someone or their movements) closely and persistently.
1. Inclined to lay down principles as incontrovertibly true.
1. Feeling or expressing great sorrow or distress.
1. A joint formed by one or more tapered projections (tenons) on one piece which interlock with corresponding notches or recesses (mortises) in another.1. Join together by means of a dovetail.
ss1. Cheerful and full of energy.
1. (of a person or their behavior) unconventional and slightly strange.1. A person of unconventional and slightly strange views or behavior.
1. Deriving ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources.1. A person who derives ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources.
1. Giving good value or service in relation to the amount of money, time, or effort spent.
(of something inanimate or abstract) successful in producing a desired or intended result
A person who is excessively conceited or self-absorbed
1. Manage to support oneself or make a living with difficulty.
1. Relating to or characteristic of an elegy.1. Verses in an elegiac meter.
1. Evoke or draw out (a response, answer, or fact) from someone in reaction to one\'s own actions or questions.
1. Evade or escape from (a danger, enemy, or pursuer), typically in a skillful or cunning way.
1. Difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
1. Make (something) more attractive by the addition of decorative details or features.
1. Showing an ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
1. Be filled with a feeling of love for.
1. Restrict or burden (someone or something) in such a way that free action or movement is difficult.
1. Attract or tempt by offering pleasure or advantage.
(of an attitude, habit, or belief) firmly established and difficult or unlikely to change
1. Lasting for a very short time.1. An ephemeral plant.
1. A pithy saying or remark expressing an idea in a clever and amusing way.
1. The manifestation of Christ to the Gentiles as represented by the Magi (Matthew 2:1–12).
1. A person after whom a discovery, invention, place, etc., is named or thought to be named.
1. Use ambiguous language so as to conceal the truth or avoid committing oneself.
1. Erring or straying from the proper course or standards.
Not even or regular in pattern or movement1. A rock or boulder that differs from the surrounding rock and is believed to have been brought from a distance by glacial action.
1. Having or showing great knowledge or learning.
1. Adopt or support (a cause, belief, or way of life)
1. A feeling or state of intense excitement and happiness.
Soon passing out of sight, memory, or existence
1. Make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
Hold (someone or something) in very high regard
1. Feel or express great loathing for.
1. Critical explanation or interpretation of a text, especially of scripture.
1. A person or thing serving as a typical example or excellent model.
1. Strongly encourage or urge (someone) to do something.
Covering a wide area in terms of space or scope
1. Present and explain (a theory or idea) systematically and in detail.
1. Erase or remove completely (something unwanted or unpleasant)
1. Remove matter thought to be objectionable or unsuitable from (a text or account)
(especially of a document) still in existence
1. (of a factor or situation) serving to lessen the seriousness of an offense.
1. Extend the application of (a method or conclusion, especially one based on statistics) to an unknown situation by assuming that existing trends will continue or similar methods will be applicable.
Treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humor
1. Relating or inclined to a state of faction.
1. Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail.
1. A young deer in its first year.1. (of a deer) produce young.
Producing or capable of producing an abundance of offspring or new growth
1. Changing frequently, especially as regards one\'s loyalties, interests, or affection.
1. Not showing a serious or respectful attitude.
1. A minor weakness or eccentricity in someone\'s character.
1. Planned for or about to happen in the near future.
1. Happening by accident or chance rather than design.
1. Sparing or economical with regard to money or food.
1. Prevent (a plan or attempted action) from progressing, succeeding, or being fulfilled.1. Frustrated.
An unintentional act or remark causing embarrassment to its originator
1. Deny or contradict (a fact or statement)
1. Shock or excite (someone) into taking action.
1. A device, action, or opening remark, typically one entailing a degree of risk, that is calculated to gain an advantage.
1. Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.
1. Relevant to a subject under consideration.
1. Manipulate the boundaries of (an electoral constituency) so as to favor one party or class.1. An instance of gerrymandering.
1. (of words or the person speaking them) fluent and voluble but insincere and shallow.
1. An excessively abundant supply of something.1. Supply or fill to excess.
1. Provoke or annoy (someone) so as to stimulate some action or reaction.1. A spiked stick used for driving cattle.
1. A shoot or twig inserted into a slit on the trunk or stem of a living plant, from which it receives sap.1. Insert (a shoot or twig) as a graft.
1. Lie or crawl abjectly on the ground with one\'s face downward.
1. A loud and boisterous laugh.1. Laugh in a loud or boisterous way.
1. Shrewd or spirited initiative and resourcefulness.
1. A large basket with a lid used for laundry.
1. Any of five tendons at the back of a person\'s knee.1. Cripple (a person or animal) by cutting their hamstrings.
1. A lengthy and aggressive speech.1. Lecture (someone) at length in an aggressive and critical manner.
Feeling strained as a result of having demands persistently made on one
1. Talk to (someone) in a bullying way.
1. Leadership or dominance, especially by one country or social group over others.
1. A person believing in or practicing religious heresy.
1. The period of a person\'s or thing\'s greatest success, popularity, or vigor.
1. Overly theatrical or melodramatic in character or style.1. Exaggerated dramatic behavior designed to attract attention.
ss1. A person who attacks cherished beliefs or institutions.
1. Characterized by attack on cherished beliefs or institutions.
1. A mode of behavior or way of thought peculiar to an individual.
1. Deserving or causing public disgrace or shame.
1. Forbidden by law, rules, or custom.
1. An extremely confused, complicated, or embarrassing situation.
1. Unchanging over time or unable to be changed.
(of behavior, performance, or appearance) in accordance with the highest standards of propriety
(of an event regarded as threatening or significant) about to happen
Assuming power or authority without justification
1. Not allowing fluid to pass through.
(of an argument or statement) not seeming reasonable or probable
1. A factor that is difficult or impossible to estimate or assess.1. Difficult or impossible to estimate, assess, or answer.
1. Harass (someone) persistently for or to do something.
Not showing care for the consequences of an action
Dispute the truth, validity, or honesty of (a statement or motive)
Represent (something, especially something undesirable) as being done, caused, or possessed by someone
1. Unable to speak distinctly or express oneself clearly.
1. (of something regarded as unpleasant) continuing without pause or interruption.
1. Not in harmony or keeping with the surroundings or other aspects of something.
1. (of a person or their tendencies) not able to be corrected, improved, or reformed.1. An incorrigible person.
1. Necessary for (someone) as a duty or responsibility.1. The holder of an office or post.
1. Formally accuse of or charge with a serious crime.
1. Lack of interest, concern, or sympathy.
1. Feeling or showing anger or annoyance at what is perceived as unfair treatment.
1. Too great or extreme to be expressed or described in words.
Unable to be resisted or avoided
1. The quality of being clever, original, and inventive.
1. (of a person or action) innocent and unsuspecting.
1. Bring oneself into favor with someone by flattering or trying to please them.
So good or unusual as to be impossible to copy
1. Showing a rude and arrogant lack of respect.
1. Destructive to both sides in a conflict.
Closely acquainted1. A very close friend.
1. Unwilling or refusing to change one\'s views or to agree about something.1. An intransigent person.
ss1. Accustom (someone) to something, especially something unpleasant.
1. Insulting, abusive, or highly critical language.
1. (of an action or situation) likely to arouse or incur resentment or anger in others.
1. Never to be broken, infringed, or dishonored.
1. Having or showing a tendency to be easily angered.
1. Traveling from place to place.1. A person who travels from place to place.
1. Special words or expressions that are used by a particular profession or group and are difficult for others to understand.
1. Extreme patriotism, especially in the form of aggressive or warlike foreign policy.
Fond of or characterized by joking
1. Act in an excessively subservient manner.1. An act of kowtowing as part of Chinese custom.
1. (especially of a task, process, or journey) requiring considerable effort and time.
1. (of a person, speech, or style of writing) using very few words.
1. Publicly criticize (someone or something) by using ridicule, irony, or sarcasm.1. A speech or text lampooning someone or something.
(of a person, manner, or gesture) displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion or effort
1. Generosity in bestowing money or gifts upon others.
1. (of a person, manner, or gesture) feeling or revealing an overt and often offensive sexual desire.
1. Cautious or wary due to realistic suspicions.
Give a lot of public attention and approval to (someone)
1. A series of petitions for use in church services or processions, usually recited by the clergy and responded to in a recurring formula by the people.
1. Looking or sounding sad and dismal.
s1. Having or showing great authority.
1. Cause or enable (a condition or state of affairs) to continue.
1. The mistaken use of a word in place of a similar-sounding one, often with an amusing effect (e.g. ‘dance a flamingo’ instead of flamenco).
1. Having or showing a wish to do evil to others.
1. Wrongdoing, especially by a public official.
1. (of a metal or other material) able to be hammered or pressed permanently out of shape without breaking or cracking.
1. A strict disciplinarian, especially in the armed forces.
1. An unorthodox or independent-minded person.1. Unorthodox.
1. Sentimental in a feeble or sickly way.
1. A short, pithy statement expressing a general truth or rule of conduct.
1. (of a river or road) follow a winding course.1. A winding curve or bend of a river or road.
1. A confused fight, skirmish, or scuffle.
(of a voice or words) sweet or musical
1. (of a person) subject to sudden or unpredictable changes of mood or mind.1. A drug or other compound containing mercury.
1. Hold the attention of (someone) to the exclusion of all else or so as to transfix them.
1. (of a person or animal) full of spirit and courage.
1. A person who dislikes humankind and avoids human society.
1. A person who behaves badly or in a way that breaks the law.1. (of a person) behaving badly or in a way that breaks a law or rule.
1. A person who dislikes, despises, or is strongly prejudiced against women.1. Relating to or characteristic of a misogynist.
1. Make less severe, serious, or painful.
1. Extract money from (someone) by fine or taxation.1. A fine or compulsory payment.
1. (of a sound or voice) quiet and soft.
1. The lowest point in the fortunes of a person or organization.
So small or unimportant as to be not worth considering
(of a person or manner) feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed
1. (of a person) surprised and confused so much that they are unsure how to react.
1. A subtle difference in or shade of meaning, expression, or sound.1. Give nuances to.
1. Stubbornly refusing to change one\'s opinion or course of action.
Willing to do a service or kindne
ssNeither parallel nor at a right angle to a specified or implied line1. A muscle neither parallel nor perpendicular to the long axis of a body or limb.
1. Obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree.
1. Stubbornly refusing to change one\'s opinion or chosen course of action, despite attempts to persuade one to do so.
1. Annoyingly insensitive or slow to understand.
Not able to be seen through1. An opaque thing or substance.
1. Turn into bone or bony tissue.
Characterized by vulgar or pretentious display
1. (of food or drink) pleasant to taste.
1. A manuscript or piece of writing material on which the original writing has been effaced to make room for later writing but of which traces remain.
1. A solution or remedy for all difficulties or diseases.
1. Flamboyant confidence of style or manner.
1. A public speech or published text in praise of someone or something.
1. A person or thing regarded as a perfect example of a particular quality.

s1. Of or like a pedant.

1. Easily irritated, especially by unimportant things.
1. Expressing contempt or disapproval.1. A word expressing contempt or disapproval.
(of a person) having a good understanding of things1. (especially in philosophy or with reference to psychic phenomena) a person who is able to perceive things.
1. (especially of a person\'s manner or actions) insisting on immediate attention or obedience, especially in a brusquely imperious way.
ss1. (of an action or gesture) carried out with a minimum of effort or reflection.
1. Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
1. Make (something, typically an undesirable situation or an unfounded belief) continue indefinitely.
1. A person who is hostile or indifferent to culture and the arts, or who has no understanding of them.1. Hostile or indifferent to culture and the arts.
1. Having a pleasantly sharp taste or appetizing flavor.

1. A very small or inadequate amount of money paid to someone as an allowance or wage.
1. A remark or statement, especially one with a moral content, that has been used too often to be interesting or thoughtful.
1. Evoking a keen sense of sadness or regret.
1. A strong verbal or written attack on someone or something.
Assume as a fact1. A statement which is made on the assumption that it will prove to be true.

1. Dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a way that is based on practical rather than theoretical considerations.
Not securely held or in position
1. An earlier event or action that is regarded as an example or guide to be considered in subsequent similar circumstances.1. Preceding in time, order, or importance.

1. Cause (an event or situation, typically one that is bad or undesirable) to happen suddenly, unexpectedly, or prematurely.1. Done, made, or acting suddenly or without careful consideration.1. A substance precipitated from a solution.
1. (of a child) having developed certain abilities or proclivities at an earlier age than usual.
A preference or special liking for something
1. Serving or intended to preempt or forestall something, especially to prevent attack by disabling the enemy.
The fact of knowing something before it takes place
1. An idea that is taken to be true, and often used as the basis for other ideas, although it is not known for certain.
1. (of a person or their behavior) failing to observe the limits of what is permitted or appropriate.
1. Speak or act in an evasive way.
1. The fact of being primary, preeminent, or more important.
The quality of having strong moral principle
sSpending money or resources freely and recklessly1. A person who spends money in a recklessly extravagant way.
1. Recklessly extravagant or wasteful in the use of resources.1. A licentious, dissolute person.
(especially of something offered or discharged) exuberantly plentiful
1. The action of foretelling or prophesying future events.
1. (of a plant, animal, or person) producing much fruit or foliage or many offspring.
1. Win or regain the favor of (a god, spirit, or person) by doing something that pleases them.

1. Convert or attempt to convert (someone) from one religion, belief, or opinion to another.
1. Tending or able to change frequently or easily.

1. Eager or quick to argue, quarrel, or fight.
1. An expert in a particular subject or field who is frequently called on to give opinions about it to the public.
1. A small, short-tailed Old World game bird resembling a small partridge, typically having brown camouflaged plumage.
1. Be entitled to a particular benefit or privilege by fulfilling a necessary condition.
1. A state of perplexity or uncertainty over what to do in a difficult situation.
1. Complaining in a petulant or whining manner.
1. A witty remark.1. Make a witty remark.
1. A traitor who collaborates with an enemy force occupying their country.
1. Involving or limited to basic principles.
Having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment
1. Making a show of being morally superior to other people.
1. Composure or coolness, sometimes excessive, as shown in danger or under trying circumstances.
1. Optimistic or positive, especially in an apparently bad or difficult situation.1. A blood-red color.
1. (of a person or action) showing dedication and diligence.
1. The outward appearance or apparent form of something, especially when the reality is different.
1. Given to moralizing in a pompous or affected manner.
1. The occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
Calm, peaceful, and untroubled1. An expanse of clear sky or calm sea.
1. An image or representation of someone or something.
1. A position requiring little or no work but giving the holder status or financial benefit.
1. Done too hurriedly and carelessly.1. Hurriedly and carelessly.
1. A slight superficial knowledge of a language or subject.
1. Having or showing an excessive pride in oneself or one\'s achievements.
1. Derogatory or mocking in an indirect way.1. An unpleasant or underhanded person or remark.
1. A grammatical mistake in speech or writing.
1. Prevent or hinder the progress of.
1. Include or absorb (something) in something else.
1. Seeking or intended to subvert an established system or institution.1. A subversive person.
Bad-tempered and sulky1. A sulky or depressed mood.
1. Behaving or looking as though one thinks one is superior to others.
1. Unnecessary, especially through being more than enough.
1. An excessive amount of something.1. Cause (someone) to desire no more of something as a result of having consumed or done it to excess.
1. A person who is self-indulgent in their fondness for sensuous luxury.
1. A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.
(of a person) reserved or uncommunicative in speech
1. Adroitness and sensitivity in dealing with others or with difficult issues.
1. Showy but cheap and of poor quality.1. Cheap and gaudy finery.
1. Revealing, indicating, or betraying something.1. A person, especially a child, who reports others\' wrongdoings or reveals their secrets.
1. A person\'s state of mind seen in terms of their being angry or calm.1. Improve the hardness and elasticity of (steel or other metal) by reheating and then cooling it.
1. Characterized by strong and turbulent or conflicting emotion.
1. Expressing or intending to promote a particular cause or point of view, especially a controversial one.
1. Showing gentleness and concern or sympathy.
1. (of a person or their behavior) using money and other resources carefully and not wastefully.

1. Prevent (someone) from accomplishing something.1. A structural crosspiece sometimes forming a seat for a rower in a boat.From one side to another side of (an area)1. From one side to another side of an area.
1. A long, angry speech of criticism or accusation.
A state of physical or mental inactivity
1. Attempt to sell (something), typically by pestering people in an aggressive or bold manner.1. A person soliciting custom or business, typically in an aggressive or bold manner.
1. (of a person) easy to control or influence.
1. Change in form, nature, or substance.
1. Painful or laborious effort.1. Engage in painful or laborious effort.
1. A false, absurd, or distorted representation of something.1. Represent in a false or distorted way.
1. Guilty of or involving betrayal or deception.
1. A cause of great trouble or suffering.
(of a remark, opinion, or idea) overused and consequently of little import
1. Shorten the duration or extent of.1. (of a leaf, feather, or other part) ending abruptly as if cut off across the base or tip.
1. Erode the base or foundation of (a rock formation)
1. A line drawn under a word or phrase for emphasis.1. Underline (something).
1. (of a person) not willing to divulge information.
1. Not particularly attractive or appealing to the eye.
(of a circumstance) not giving or indicating a good chance of succe
ss1. Disorderly and disruptive and not amenable to discipline or control.
1. (of behavior or actions) not proper or appropriate.
1. (especially of a position or view) not able to be maintained or defended against attack or objection.
Not deprived of freedom of action or expression
1. (of a person, especially a man) suave, courteous, and refined in manner.
Having or showing a lack of thought or intelligence
1. Praised or boasted about, especially in an excessive way.
1. A thin decorative covering of fine wood applied to a coarser wood or other material.1. Cover (something) with a decorative layer of fine wood.
1. The appearance of being true or real.
1. Experienced in the imagination through the feelings or actions of another person.
1. A change of circumstances or fortune, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant.
1. Compete eagerly with someone in order to do or achieve something.
1. Speak or write about in an abusively disparaging manner.
1. A domineering, violent, or bad-tempered woman.
1. Blame or insult (someone) in strong or violent language.
1. (especially of a person or speech) vehement or clamorous.
The quality of talking fluently, readily, or incessantly
1. Wanting or devouring great quantities of food.
1. Lacking in a certain required or necessary quality.
A sticky yellowish moldable substance secreted by honeybees as the material of honeycomb1. Cover or treat (something) with wax or a similar substance, typically to polish or protect it.
1. Playfully quaint or fanciful, especially in an appealing and amusing way.
1. Attractive or appealing in appearance or character.
1. The defining spirit or mood of a particular period of history as shown by the ideas and beliefs of the time.
1. The time at which something is most powerful or successful.

the act of calling down a curse that invokes evil (and usually serves as an insult)
characterized by undue haste and lack of thought or deliberation
not admitting of passage or capable of being affected
not easily perturbed or excited or upset; marked by extreme calm and composure
a situation in which no progress can be made or no advancement is possible
all of the same or similar kind or nature
showing characteristics of age, especially having grey or white hair
consisting of elements that are not of the same kind or nature
the dominance or leadership of one social group or nation over others
naive and easily deceived or tricked
of great gravity or crucial import; requiring serious thought
instinctively or temperamentally seeking and enjoying the company of others
relative position in a graded series
excessively agitated; distraught with fear or other violent emotion
stubbornly resistant to authority or control
having no cause or apparent cause
bathe with warm water or medicated lotions
left unplowed and unseeded during a growing season
precisely and clearly expressed or readily observable; leaving nothing to implication
(anthropology) the distinctive spirit of a culture or an era
confined to and understandable by only an enlightened inner circle
of or relating to a disease (or anything resembling a disease) constantly present to greater or lesser extent in a particular locality
compete with successfully; approach or reach equality with
a representation of a person (especially in the form of sculpture)
capacity or power to produce a desired effect
comical in an odd or whimsical manner
a doctrine or code of beliefs accepted as authoritative
having a daily cycle or occurring every day
cause to expand as it by internal pressure
fundamentally different or distinct in quality or kind
so thin as to transmit light
marked by lack of definite plan or regularity or purpose; jumping from one thing to another
treat or speak of with contempt
mar or spoil the appearance of
characterized by propriety and dignity and good taste in manners and conduct
disposed to believe on little evidence
lacking even the rudiments of courage; abjectly fearful
highly complex or intricate and occasionally devious
excuse, overlook, or make allowances for; be lenient with
free from provincial prejudices or attachments
something that causes an important event to happen
determined by chance or impulse or whim rather than by necessity or reason
openly straightforward and direct without reserve or secretiveness
a flock of birds (especially when gathered close together on the ground)
of a stern or strict bearing or demeanor; forbidding in aspect
an event that is experienced as indicating important things to come
launch an attack or assault on; begin hostilities or start warfare with
expressing yourself easily or characterized by clear expressive language
feelings of great warmth and intensity
so extremely old as seeming to belong to an earlier period
based on or subject to individual discretion or preference or sometimes impulse or caprice
the object of a feeling of intense aversion; something to be avoided
similar or equivalent in some respects though otherwise dissimilar
open to two or more interpretations; or of uncertain nature or significance; or (often) intended to mislead
relating to or dealing with the subject of aesthetics
corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance; often by replacing valuable ingredients with inferior ones
the highest level or degree attainable; the highest stage of development
something contributing to growth or increase
run away; usually includes taking something or somebody along
formally reject or disavow a formerly held belief, usually under pressure
markedly different from an accepted norm
